summary: Email correspondence between defense attorneys from WilmerHale and a federal prosecutor regarding scheduling a call and obtaining a trial subpoena for a JPMorgan witness in the Ghislaine Maxwell criminal case. The emails discuss coordinating meetings and the need for a witness from JPMorgan to testify at trial.

persons.name: Allison Stoddart
persons.context: Attorney from WilmerHale representing or involved in the Ghislaine Maxwell case, coordinating scheduling and witness matters with the prosecution.

persons.name: Anjan Sahni
persons.context: Attorney from WilmerHale copied on emails regarding the Ghislaine Maxwell case, involved in discussions about trial witnesses.

persons.name: Pat McHugh
persons.context: Mentioned as someone the defense team wishes to set up a call with, likely another attorney or team member involved in the case.

persons.name: Maurene
persons.context: Referred to in an email, likely an Assistant United States Attorney (AUSA) from the Southern District of New York, involved in providing a subpoena for a JPMorgan witness.

persons.name: Lara
persons.context: Referred to alongside Maurene, likely another prosecutor from the Southern District of New York involved in the case.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, the subject of the legal correspondence.

connections.description: Both are attorneys at WilmerHale law firm working together on the Ghislaine Maxwell defense team, as indicated by being copied on the same emails.
Stoddart (defense) is corresponding with prosecutor Maurene regarding trial logistics and witness subpoenas for the Maxwell case.
Stoddart is attempting to arrange a call between the prosecution team and Pat McHugh, suggesting McHugh is part of or associated with the defense team.
Sahni (defense) is copied on emails where prosecutor Maurene is discussing witness subpoenas and trial exhibits.

events.title: Jury Selection for Maxwell Trial
events.description: Jury selection is mentioned as being scheduled to be underway the week of November 15, 2021, indicating the impending trial phase.

events.title: Call Regarding Trial Witness Topic
events.description: Defense attorney Allison Stoddart requests a call with prosecutors to provide an update on the trial witness topic, specifically regarding a JPMorgan witness.

events.title: Request for JPMorgan Trial Subpoena
events.description: Defense requests a trial appearance subpoena from prosecutors for a witness from JPMorgan to testify at the Maxwell trial.

locations: 7 World Trade Center, 250 Greenwich Street, New York, NY 10007
One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The defense team for Ghislaine Maxwell, represented by WilmerHale attorneys, is coordinating with federal prosecutors to secure a trial witness from JPMorgan.
A trial appearance subpoena is being requested by the defense from the prosecution to compel a JPMorgan witness to testify.
Jury selection for the Maxwell trial was scheduled to be underway in mid-November 2021.
The correspondence reveals ongoing pretrial logistics and evidence discussions between the defense and prosecution.
The prosecution is from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, indicating federal jurisdiction over the case.
